title: Seung-Hui Cho
summary: Seung-Hui Cho (Korean: 조승희, properly Cho Seung-hui;[3] January 18, 1984 – April 16, 2007) was a South Korean[4][5][6] mass murderer responsible for perpetrating the Virginia Tech shooting. Cho killed 32 people and wounded 17 others with two semi-automatic pistols on April 16, 2007, at Virginia Tech in Blacksburg, Virginia. This killing is the deadliest school shooting in US history,[7] and was at the time the deadliest one-man shooting rampage in modern US history[8] and deadliest mass shooting in US history.[lower-alpha 1][12][11] A senior-level undergraduate student at the university, he committed suicide after police breached the doors of Virginia Tech's Norris Hall which Cho had locked with heavy chains, where most of the shooting had taken place.[13][14][12]
